rationale: S. beaufortii has been assessed as Near Threatened because of an inferred population decline of 20-29% in the past ten years as a result of removal from the wild, a large number of hydrological changes, including dams, in this area, and high levels of pollution; S. beauforti is known to be intolerant of high nitrate levels.
assessor: Jenkins, A., Kullander, F.F. & Tan, H.H.
evaluator: Collen, B., Darwall, W., Ram, M. & Smith, K. (SRLI Freshwater Fish Evaluation Workshop)
